meanings.definition: The act of making something more native or indigenous.
meanings.sent1: The indigenization of traditional clothing helped preserve our cultural heritage.
meanings.sent2: The indigenization of the menu included adding local ingredients to the dishes.
meanings.sent3: The indigenization of the school uniform with feathers and beads made everyone look unique.
meanings.sent4: The indigenization of the music scene brought a fresh, local sound to the industry.
meanings.sent5: The indigenization of the art gallery showcased the talents of native artists.

meanings.definition: The process of adapting something to fit the culture or customs of a particular place.
meanings.sent1: Indigenization of the language involved incorporating local dialects into the vocabulary.
meanings.sent2: The indigenization of the architecture reflected the traditional building styles of the region.
meanings.sent3: The indigenization of the dance routine with cultural movements added a fun twist.
meanings.sent4: The indigenization of the garden design harmonized nature with the surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The indigenization of the celebration embraced local customs and rituals.

meanings.definition: The policy or practice of promoting the interests of indigenous inhabitants in a country or region.
meanings.sent1: The government's indigenization program aimed to empower local communities.
meanings.sent2: The indigenization of education focused on incorporating indigenous knowledge into the curriculum.
meanings.sent3: The indigenization of the workforce with more native employees created a stronger sense of community.
meanings.sent4: The indigenization of healthcare services ensured better access for indigenous populations.
meanings.sent5: The indigenization of land ownership laws protected the rights of indigenous peoples.
